intro: Planchonella sandwicensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian sandwicensis or the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. It produces small, round fruits that are edible and contain a single seed. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
